meanings.definition: A plug or cork used to stop up a hole or opening.
meanings.sent1: I used a stopple to seal the leak in the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The stopple kept the liquid from spilling out.
meanings.sent3: The stopple in the sink decided to take a break and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a stopple, sealing away the sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright red stopple contrasted beautifully with the clear glass bottle.

meanings.definition: To close or block off with a stopple.
meanings.sent1: I stoppled the test tube carefully to prevent any spills.
meanings.sent2: She stopples the jar tightly to keep the contents fresh.
meanings.sent3: The magician stoppled the hat, making the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: His words stoppled her heart, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The chef stoppled the wine bottle expertly, preserving its flavor.

meanings.definition: The act of stopping up or sealing with a stopple.
meanings.sent1: The stopple of the bottle was done with precision.
meanings.sent2: His stopple of the pipe prevented any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The stopple of the door was so tight, even the sound couldn't escape.
meanings.sent4: The stopple of the envelope kept the secret safe inside.
meanings.sent5: The stopple of the dam held back the rushing water, creating a calm lake.
